citation.article-title: Syntrophomonas erecta subsp. sporosyntropha subsp. nov., a spore-forming bacterium that degrades short chain fatty acids in co-culture with methanogens

p.s: Emended description of the genus Syntrophomonas (McInerney et al. [7])

The genus description is the same as that of McInerney et al. [7] except that cells have multilayered Gram-negative cell walls, and some strains form spores when cocultured with methanogens on short chain fatty acids.
Isolated from anaerobic environments such as aquatic sediments, digester sludge, rumen digest and rice field mud.
